subject: RE: [junit] Let's try this all again
msgSnippet: ... If there are n layers of tests, then Werkz looks like an excellent candidate. If two layers, then perhaps it is overkill. Take care. J. B. Rainsberger,
messageBody:
>So said Ilja Preuss on 2003-08-04 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
>>> The test runner engine would need to "sort" the calling order be
>>> dependency tree, and would need to know when not to call something,
>>> perhaps introducing a new state ("deferred" -- meaning not run due
>>> to a dependency failure/error -- to add to "fail", "error".)
>>
>> The sorting part is not easy.
>
>Perhaps you could let Werkz <http://werkz.sourceforge.net/> do the work.
>Running the high level tests would be a goal depending on the
>successfull run of the lower level tests, so it seems to me. OTOH it
>might also be overkill...

If there are 'n' layers of tests, then Werkz looks like an excellent candidate. If two layers, then perhaps it is overkill.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
telephone: +1 416 791-8603
